#' Nathan Kosiba
#' @section Last Update Date:
#' 8/28/2020

This section contains details of each test executed. Checks verifying each test are included as sub-bullets of their associated test.

+ Setup: _No prerequisites required_

  + T1: Population data can be specified by the user and treatment variable can be specified
    + T1.1: Verify target dataset in table is the same as specified
    + T1.2: Verify treatment variable in table is the same as specified
  + T2: Population data subset can be specified on user specified conditions
    + T2.1: Population data created matches data subset as specified
  + T3: Manual groups can be specified by combining different subgroups and header N counts will be specified from these groups within the population data
    + T3.1: Population groups can be added by combining existing groups
    + T3.2: Header N counts of combined groups match the combined total of the groups
  + T4: Analysis data can be specified by the user and treatment variable can be specified for the analysis population
    + T4.1: Verify analysis dataset in layer is the same as specified when inherited from table
    + T4.2: Verify treatment variable in layer is the same as specified when inherited from table
  + T5: Population data and treatment variable can be specified independent of analysis data and treatment variable
    + T5.1: Verify population data can be manually specified if not the same as analysis data
    + T5.2: Verify analysis data can be manually specified if not the same as population data
    + T5.3: Verify population treatment variable can be manually specified if not the same as analysis treatment variable
    + T5.4: Verify analysis treatment variable can be manually specified if not the same as population treatment variable
  + T6: Analysis data subset can be specified on user specified conditions
    + T6.1: Analysis data created matches data subset as specified
  + T7: n counts of values within a variable can be produced
    + T7.1: Complete data value n counts can be produced within a variable
    + T7.2: Distinct data value n counts can be produced within a variable
  + T8: n counts of values within a group of variables can be produced
    + T8.1: Complete data value n counts can be produced within a group of variables
    + T8.2: Distinct data value n counts can be produced within a group of variables
  + T9: Total n counts can be added
    + T9.1: Total n count can be added within a layer
  + T10: Missing n count handling can be specified including presentation and denominator handling
    + T10.1: Missing n count rows can be added within a layer
    + T10.2: Missing values can be excluded from the layer denominator
  + T11: Dummy values can be specified for categories that need to be presented but may not exist within the data and missing values can be set to a user specified string
    + T11.1: Values specified by user are presented in the output table
    + T11.2: Missing values can be set to a user specified string
  + T12: Counts can be produced as n (%)
    + T12.1: When specified, both n and % can be displayed in a n (%) fashion
    + T12.2: Distinct n and % can be displayed in a n (%) fashion
    + T12.3: Distinct and non-distinct n and % can be presented together
  + T13: When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the analysis data
    + T13.1: Check denominators created match counts from analysis data
    + T13.2: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from analysis data 
  + T14: When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a particular manually specified subset
    + T14.1: Check denominators created match counts using specified conditions
    + T14.2: Check % produced use denominators matching counts using specified conditions
  + T15: When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the population data
    + T15.1: Check denominators created match counts from population data
    + T15.2: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from population data
  + T16: For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a grouping of variables
    + T16.1: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from grouping variables
  + T17: Risk difference including confidence interval can be produced based on specified treatment groupings and arguments can be passed through to prop.test
    + T17.1: Check that risk difference calculated between groupings is correct
    + T17.2: Check that confidence interval calculated between groupings is correct
    + T17.3: Arguments passed through to prop.test create the correct output
    + T17.4: Risk difference estimate and confidence interval can be computed across values of the treatment variable and cols argument
  + T18: The descriptive statistics of n, mean, median, IQR, Q1, Q3, standard deviation, variance, min, max, and missing can be produced based on an input variable
    + T18.1: Check the computed statistic of n matches the expected value
    + T18.2: Check the computed statistic of mean matches the expected value
    + T18.3: Check the computed statistic of median matches the expected value
    + T18.4: Check the computed statistic of IQR matches the expected value
    + T18.5: Check the computed statistic of Q1 matches the expected value
    + T18.6: Check the computed statistic of Q3 matches the expected value
    + T18.7: Check the computed statistic of standard deviation matches the expected value
    + T18.8: Check the computed statistic of variance matches the expected value
    + T18.9: Check the computed statistic of min matches the expected value
    + T18.10: Check the computed statistic of max matches the expected value
    + T18.11: Check the computed statistic of missing matches the expected value
  + T19: Custom descriptive statistics can be produced based on an input variable and a specified formula
    + T19.1: Check that the computed statistic value matches the value from the specified formula
  + T20: Descriptive statistics can be performed across discrete values within a grouping variable or a group of grouping variables
    + T20.1: Check the statistic values match the values from the specified grouping variable
  + T21: Multiple statistics can be presented in one line
    + T21.1: Check that the output can include multiple statistics on the same line
  + T22: Decimal precision and integer length can be specified by the user
    + T22.1: The output decimal precision and integer length is the same as the user specified values
  + T23: Decimal precision and integer length can be dynamically created from analysis data
    + T23.1: The output decimal precision and integer length is the same as the decimal precision and integer length from the target data variable
  + T24: Presentation format can be specified by the user including desired non-numeric text and align per user specification
    + T24.1: The output string is formatted the same as user specification including non-numeric text and alignment
  + T25: Descriptive statistic missing values can be set to a user specified string
    + T25.1: Missing values can be set to a user specified string
  + T26: Shift n counts of values using two variables, a 'from' and a 'to' variable, can be produced
    + T26.1: n counts can be created in a shift manner using a from and to variable
  + T27: Shift n counts of values within a variable can be produced
    + T27.1: n counts can be created in a shift manner using a from and to variable and a by variable
  + T28: Shift n counts of values within a group of variables can be produced
    + T28.1: n counts can be created in a shift manner using a from and to variable and multiple by variables
  + T29: Dummy values for shift counts can be specified for categories that need to be presented but may not exist within the data
    + T29.1: Values specified by user for the shift variables are presented in the output table
  + T30: Shift counts can be produced as n (%)
    + T30.1: When specified, both n and % can be displayed in a n (%) fashion for shift layer
  + T31: For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the analysis data
    + T31.1: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from analysis data 
  + T32: For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a particular manually specified subset
    + T32.1: Check % produced use denominators matching counts using specified conditions
  + T33: For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the population data
    + T33.1: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from population data
  + T34: For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a grouping of variables
    + T34.1: Check % produced use denominators matching counts from grouping variables
  + T35: Row labels can be manually specified by the user
    + T35.1: Check row labels in output table match user specified values
  + T36: Row labels can be nested to put a subgroup within a parent group
    + T36.1: Check row labels and nesting in output table match user specified values and nesting
  + T37: Summaries can be stacked on top of one another
    + T37.1: Check multiple summaries mixed between descriptive statistics and count are created they can be stacked 
  + T38: Summaries can be sorted based on manual sorting by presentation specified order
    + T38.1: Check that output table has correct count sorting variables matching specified order
  + T39: Summaries can be sorted based on count based sorting (either ascending or descending) by a specified treatment group
    + T39.1: Check that output table has correct count sorting variables for count based sorting
  + T40: Summaries can be sorted based on alphabetical sorting based on data values
    + T40.1: Check that output table has correct count sorting variables for data values
  + T41: Summaries can be sorted based on a numeric version of the target variable if available
    + T41.1: Check that output table has correct count sorting variables for the corresponding numeric variable
  + T42: Summary by variables will be sorted by a numeric variable if available and then by factor
    + T42.1: Check that ouput table has correct sorting variables for supplied by variables
  + T43: Nested layers can be sorted independently using different methods
    + T43.1: Check that when different methods are supplied for nested layers they are applied correctly
  + T44: Independent layers can be sorted using different methods and stacked using common sorting variables
    + T44.1: Check that when different methods are supplied for independent layers they are applied correctly
  + T45: Count layer default formats can be set at the table level
    + T45.1: Check that count layer formats set at the table level are applied to layers created
    + T45.2: Check that count layer formats applied at the layer level take prescedence over table level formats
  + T46: Descriptive statistics layer default formats can be set at the table level
    + T46.1: Check that descriptive statistics layer formats set at the table level are applied to layers created
    + T47.2: Check that descriptive statistics layer formats applied at the layer level take prescedence over table level formats
  + T47: Shift layer default formats can be set at the table level
    + T47.1: Check that shift layer formats set at the table level are applied to layers created
    + T47.2: Check that shift layer formats applied at the layer level take prescedence over table level formats
  + T48: Option for count layer default formats can be specified by the user
    + T48.1: Check that the count layer defail formats specified in the option are displayed in the table
  + T49: Option for descriptive statistics layer default formats can be specified by the user
    + T49.1: Check that the descriptive statistics layer defail formats specified in the option are displayed in the table
  + T50: Option for shift layer default formats can be specified by the user
    + T50.1: Check that the shift layer defail formats specified in the option are displayed in the table
  + T51: Option for a cap on auto precision can be specified by the user
    + T51.1: Check that the cap on auto precision specified by the user is displayed correctly in the table for both integers and decimals
  + T52: Option for custom descriptive statistics can be specified by the user for use in the table
    + T52.1: Check that custom descriptive statistics set in the options can be used and displayed correctly in the table
  + T53: Option for setting scipen internal option can be specified by the user
    + T53.1: Check that scientific notation supplied is displayed correctly in the table
  + T54: Option for setting quantile algorithm choice can be specified by the user
    + T54.1: Check that the quantile algorithm supplied is used in table q1 and q3 calculation
  + T55: Column headers can be added to the output object
    + T55.1: Check that column headers added match those in the output object
  + T56: Row breaks can be added between sections based on grouping variables and row labels can be masked in a hierarchical fashion
    + T56.1: Check that a row break is added between each section based on the supplied grouping variables and row labels can be masked in a hierarchical fashion
  + T57: A table object is returned in a format that is ready to be cosmetically prepared
    + T57.1: Check that the table object can be easily cosmetically prepared
